person.content:
Please identify the "Person" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: British Prime Minister John Major 's office said on Friday that rebel Conservative MP Sir John Gorst had not " resigned the whip " ( quit the parliamentary party ) and the government still had a majority in the 651-seat parliament .

Let's think step by step.

In this paragraph, the following entities can be identified as "Person":

1. John Major - British Prime Minister
2. Sir John Gorst - rebel Conservative MP

So, there are two "Person" entities in the paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Person.

Of course! Here are the entities that refer to "Person" in the paragraph:

1. John Major
2. Sir John Gorst

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Person".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities that refer to "Person" in the paragraph:

| Person |
| --- |
| John Major |
| Sir John Gorst |

organization.content:
Please identify the "Organization" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: British Prime Minister John Major 's office said on Friday that rebel Conservative MP Sir John Gorst had not " resigned the whip " ( quit the parliamentary party ) and the government still had a majority in the 651-seat parliament .

Let's think step by step.

In this paragraph, the following entities can be identified as "Organization":

1. British Prime Minister's office - This is an organization within the government of the United Kingdom, led by the Prime Minister.
2. Conservative MP - This is an organization of members of Parliament who belong to the Conservative political party.
3. Parliament - This is the legislative body of the United Kingdom, composed of 651 members (MPs).

So, the organizations mentioned in the paragraph are:

1. British Prime Minister's office
2. Conservative MP
3. Parliament
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Organization.

Sure, here are the entities that refer to Organization in the paragraph:

1. British Prime Minister's office - This is an organization within the government of the United Kingdom, led by the Prime Minister.
2. Conservative MP - This is an organization of members of Parliament who belong to the Conservative political party.

So, the entities that refer to Organization in the paragraph are:

1. British Prime Minister's office
2. Conservative MP

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph that refer to Organization:

| Organization |
